result.execSummary:
The defendant Wade A. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wade A. Nelson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Wade A. Nelson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wade A. Nelson

records.addlTxt: Commitment paid of $423.50 by credit card

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Wade A. Nelson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Peebles agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.  
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed. 

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Pay fine of $100.00 + costs = $473.50
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Pay within 60 days

Ct. 2 to be dismissed
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Discovery invoice
Return date on April 5, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Attorney James D. Peebles in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Peebles states that there is an offer that his client is going to accept.  Atty Peebles states that he received a call that he is stuck in the snow.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 09:45 am.
Return date on March 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Wade A. Nelson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Peebles is recently on the case. Atty Peebles agrees and has had brief discussions with Atty Hendee.  Atty Peebles asks for more time to discuss resolution.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant gives new address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
